column1: Efficient Optimal Approximation of Discrete Random Variables for Estimation of Probabilities of Missing Deadlines
Liat Cohen@Ben-Gurion University of the Negev
column2: Gera Weiss@Ben-Gurion University of the Negev

column1: AAAI Technical Track: Reasoning under Uncertainty
We present an efficient algorithm that
column2: given a discrete random variable X and a number m
column3: computes a random variable whose support is of size at most m and whose Kolmogorov distance from X is minimal. We present some variants of the algorithm
column4: analyse their correctness and computational complexity
column5: and present a detailed empirical evaluation that shows how they performs in practice. The main application that we examine
column6: which is our motivation for this work
column7: is estimation of the probability of missing deadlines in series-parallel schedules. Since exact computation of these probabilities is NP-hard
column8: we propose to use the algorithms described in this paper to obtain an approximation.
